required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetic Profile of Oral AB680 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetic Profile of Oral AB680 in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetic Profile of Oral AB680 in Healthy Volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will evaluate minimum of 2 dose levels of AB680 in 8 participants per cohort. Cohorts will be gender-balanced to the extent possible, and will be randomized 3:1, active vs placebo, respectively.
The participants will be closely observed to monitor the general tolerability of AB680.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From First Dose Date to 15 Days After the Last Dose of AB680
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with TEAEs as Assessed by CTCAE v5.0.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From First Dose Date to 15 Days After the Last Dose of AB680
primary_outcome.description: Cmax as Measured by the Area Under Concentration-Time Curve from Plasma Collection and Analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From First Dose Date to 15 Days After the Last Dose of AB680
primary_outcome.description: Tmax as Measured by the Time to Maximum Concentration-Time Curve from Plasma Collection and Analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From First Dose Date to 15 Days After the Last Dose of AB680
secondary_outcome.description: Enzymatic Activity of CD73 Measured in Participant Blood Samples.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of AB680 at one of two ascending dose levels. Assignment to receive AB680 or matching placebo will be random.
Participants will receive matching placebo as a single oral dose. Assignment to receive AB680 or matching placebo will be random.

intervention.description: AB680 is a Cluster of Differentiation (CD)73 Inhibitor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 55 years, inclusive, at screening
- Body mass index 19 to 30 kg/m2
- Willing and able to sign informed consent
- Negative tests for hepatitis B surface antigen, anti-hepatitis C virus, and human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-1 and HIV-2 antibody at screening
- Healthy as determined by pre-study screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of clinically significant drug and/or food allergies
- Positive drug and alcohol screen at screening and (each) admission to the clinical research center.
- Participation in a drug study within 60 days prior to (the first) drug administration in the current study. Participation in more than 4 other drug studies in the 12 months prior to (the first) drug administration in the current study
- Participants who have significant infection or known inflammatory process on screening or admission
